title: American_Top_40_1981_December_12th
description:
"Hello again and welcome to American Top 40. My name is Casey Kasem and we're about to do our weekly 

countdown of the most popular songs in the land. Our rankings are straight off the official Billboard 

surveys of record stores and radio stations across the USA. We're all ready to count 'em down to the top 

song in the nation."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a 

recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Don McLean is at number 40 with his hit "Castles In The Air." This was the flip side of his hit 

"Vincent" from nine years ago.

Survivor and the Go-Go's have their first top 40 hits.

A listener wants to know, "What family act in the rock era has hit the number one the most times?" The 

family that did it broke up in 1969, only to reform and hit number one six times in a row.

Archie, George, Ronnie, Daniel, Mark, and marvelous Marlo, all at El Reno Federal Prison in Oklahoma ask 

for a Long Distance Dedication to themselves. In anticipation of their release, the song is "I'm Coming 

Out" by Diana Ross.

Casey answers the question, "What recording acts have had the most million selling records, counting 

both singles and albums?" Casey lists the top five, two of whom are in this countdown.

LW#3: Every Little Thing She Does Is Magic - The Police
LW#2: Waiting For A Girl Like You - Foreigner
LW#1: Physical - Olivia Newton-John
